availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Duncan McIver (Montgomery County, Illinois, farmer and 2nd lieutenant 122nd Illinois Infantry (U.S.A.))

body.p: Montgomery County, Illinois, farmer and soldier. Illinois native. Son of William McIver. Married to Mary Ann McIver. Father of Frances McIver, Charles McIver, William McIver, and Minie McIver. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Soldier in Paducah, Kentucky in 1863. Served in the 122nd Illinois Infantry (U.S.A.) as private and 2nd lieutenant from September 4, 1862 to July 15, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Montgomery County, Township 10 N Range 5 W, p. 338.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Macoupin County, Township 11 Range 6, p. 66B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Montgomery County, IL, Month 1863, p. 92 of 469 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Illinois, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 59.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Illinois, vol. 7, 1861-1866 (Springfield, IL: Springfield, Baker, Bailhache & Co., printers, 1867), pp. 59, 68.
U.S. Returns from Military Posts, 1806-1916Paducah, Kentucky, September 1861-December 1872, p. 107 of 274 microfilm, viewed on ancestry.com on January 12, 2021.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #401962, Certificate #352440.
Find A Grave, "Duncan C. McIver (1831-1887)," Memorial #65781692, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65781692 (accessed January 12, 2021).
